Data used

To train the model the data used was from Kaggle. To be exact from this link.

This data is obviously biased since it is of young children from a very specific part of the world. Due to not being able to find any other expansive source I decided to settle and use this data set. The data is a series of x-ray images.

The data was originally divided into two cases, normal cases and Pneumonia cases. After starting to train my model I realized that the images were all named according to the actual case. Whether bacterial, viral or normal. I then modified the data to adjust for the sake of specifity and training time.

Technologies used

The technologies used for this project were Flask, Pytorch and both HTML and CSS. The reason for Pytorch over other machine learning libraries is due to the much more easier deployment methods such as Flask.

Since Python has such a large expanse on fields, from web dev to machine learning, it is easier to deploy and make use of my work. Making Python my preferred language at the time.

Originally I was going to create my own custom model, but then realized that would be impractical and not to current standards. I therefore used transfer learning from resnet34. This greatly helped my training time.

Time & Perfomance

For this project I used the majority of a summer. Within this time I learned machine learning fundamentals and how to make my own custom models. The current model being used for this website is of around 74% between the three possible cases. This is not great, but do to time and hardware constraints I can't afford to continue training. If anyone would like the model please see the contact page.
